metadata.Name: RuCoLA
metadata.Description: RuCoLA is a dataset for linguistic acceptability classification in Russian, containing 13.4k sentences labeled as acceptable or not, with coarse-grained annotation of four violation categories for 3.7k unacceptable sentences.
Provider: Center for Information and Language Processing (CIS)
metadata.Paper Title: RuCoLA: Russian Corpus of Linguistic Acceptability
metadata.Venue Name: 2022 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
Affiliations: Center for Information and Language Processing (CIS)
metadata.Abstract: This paper introduces RuCoLA, a novel benchmark of 13.4k sentences labeled as acceptable or not, for linguistic acceptability classification in Russian. RuCoLA combines in-domain sentences manually collected from linguistic literature and out-of-domain sentences produced by nine machine translation and paraphrase generation models. The paper describes the data collection protocol and presents a fine-grained analysis of acceptability classification experiments with a range of baseline approaches.
